highlights.title: Are stray dogs more important than children?
highlights.description:
Our rules and reforms seem to place more importance on stray dogs than on children and ordinary citizens. There are countless regulations and orders concerning the culling and control of stray dog populations. This must change. The rules should prioritize human welfare and be governed by local self-government bodies.

Why are animal lovers so strongly in favor of stray dogs, yet remain silent when it comes to the killing of innocent cattle and other animals that harm agriculture—not humans?
